review_title: You will never get full time work unless you switch to sales
job_title: Asst. Professor in Saint Petersburg Beach, FL
pros: Sometimes you can use your asst faculty card for museum discounts
cons: They do not promote from within, unless your family has given hundreds of thousands. Like many colleges they will give you as much adjunct work as you want, but you won’t get benefits or get paid extra for the meetings you attend or classes you create. Also like other colleges, they are very customer service oriented. If a kid cheats, don’t expect the school to back you up.

job_title: Assistant Professor in Saint Petersburg Beach, FL
pros: I can't think of any.
cons: Professional educators should avoid Eckerd. The environment is toxic and deeply unprofessional.

job_title: Professor in Saint Petersburg Beach, FL
pros: It's by the water. The ocean breezes are wonderful.
cons: The faculty is made up of people who were never quite good enough, therefore are incredibly lazy. They don't push the students and only show up to keep their jobs.

job_title: Program Director in Saint Petersburg Beach, FL
pros: Love the community. Love my colleagues. Love the mission
cons: Nothing to say. Love eckerd

job_title: Career Advisor in Saint Petersburg Beach, FL
pros: Great community, colleagues, and students
cons: Salary was low given experience

review_title: Needs to be Paid Way More
job_title: Student Leader
pros: Fun work environment, good team, inside knowledge on major events
cons: Paid too little and not for all your hours. Capped paid hours that cover a fraction of the real time you spend

job_title: Tutor in Saint Petersburg, FL
pros: good pay, friendly people, lovely environment

job_title: Analyst in Saint Petersburg, FL
pros: Flexible schedule, self-supervision, light turn-up

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Saint Pete, FL
pros: I was very early in my work experience stage of life and I was given a good amount of new learning and portfolio building opportunities on a beautiful campus. Pretty fun crew to work with.
cons: Not much bad to say about the department from my point of view. I was in an assistant position so work got repetitive sometimes and work will be very edited to keep the image of the school correct.

review_title: Racist institution, disappointing place to work

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Saint Pete, FL
pros: Great and easy way to help pay for college while attending. Pros are there are always great people to work alongside.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Saint Petersburg Beach, FL
pros: Commited people, Mission centric, Professional, Freindly, the best.

job_title: Online Tutor in Saint Petersburg, FL
pros: Great place to attend college and work.

job_title: in Saint Petersburg, FL
pros: Very nice location. Laid back atmosphere. Reasonable work expectation.  Good benefits.
cons: Relatively low pay with often and constant promises for pay scales or pay reform. Very difficult to advance. Management ranges from very good to Neanderthal-like. Upper management and President's office have been known to fire people with little or no due-process. Rampant nepotism evident in  director level employees..

job_title: Student Assistant in Saint Petersburg, FL
pros: Understanding bosses, schedule flexibility, above min. wage hourly salary and being paid every 2 weeks.
cons: Not much to report as I was only a student worker on campus so didn't have to do certain things that a full time salaried worker would have to do.

job_title: Computer Analyst in Saint Petersburg, FL
pros: Beautiful Campus, Good 403B, extremely laid back working environment, Caring and dedicated co-workers.
cons: Salary was abysmal. There is no performance bonus. Very little training or opportunities to advance. There were multi-million dollar construction projects being finished but zero raises for the several years I worked there.

job_title: in Saint Petersburg, FL
pros: You have long vacation, just like any university and college all over the world. The colleagues are generally very nice and helpful.
cons: But you need to teach otherwise, a lot. Also the administration almost only cares about if the students are satisfied or not.

job_title: Circulation Assistant in Saint Petersburg, FL
pros: It was great being able to do home work at "work", flexible hrs and scheduling, great for a work study job. great work environment. Awesome community of chill, laid back, liberian type folk.
cons: I have no cons to speak of, except maybe that the pay is pretty low, was Florida minimum wage and I think it requires that you met requirements for work study.

job_title: Assistant Professor in Saint Petersburg, FL
pros: Beautiful campus and long summer vacation time, if you are lucky not teaching an autumn term in August.
cons: Pay is well-below other private liberal arts colleges. All faculty member are required to teach out of their expertise field. Many policies were made without seek faculty opinions.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Saint Petersburg, FL
pros:
The employee benefits are excellent.
We work in a park-like setting; lovely views out office windows and a pleasant place for walking during work-breaks.
Intelligent community.
Caring and dedicated co-workers.
cons:
Sometimes college students (our "customers") can make foolish choices ...
Salaries could be higher.

job_title: Assistant Student Enrollment Manager in Saint Petersburg, FL
pros: Employer contribution to retirement fund is excellent. Physical setting is beautiful (surrounded on 3 sides by water and heavily treed.) Eckerd College community is very committed to recycling and other ecological and global responsibilities.
cons: Private college so salaries are not high and resources are not abundant. As typical with academia, higher degrees are revered and those without them are often devalued.

job_title: Media Services in Saint Petersburg, FL
pros: I work in IT and this is by far the best culture for support staff. Highly appreciative for every time that you fix something and understanding when you don't or can't.
cons: There are no cons that I can see so far except maybe salary stagnation, but I'm completely fine with how much I'm making as of right now

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Saint Petersburg, FL
pros:
Great Location,, flexibility in hours worked!
Fair Benefits
Convenient Parking
cons:
Low pay

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Raleigh, NC
pros: Beautiful campus on Boca Ciega Bay in St. Petersburg, Florida. Exceptional benefits, including tuition benefits offered in an intellectually stimulating work environment.

-hours are very easy
- co-lifeguards are friendly

job_title: Mail Room Clerk in Saint Petersburg, FL
pros: Eckerd students are wonderful to cater to, and the added bonus of showing up to work whenever I wanted to was exceptional as well.
cons: Working in the mail room can become rather tedious.

job_title: Work Study Job in Saint Petersburg, FL
pros: Good work, job allows for a focus on school work.

job_title: Associate Professor in Saint Petersburg, FL

review_title: My experience at Eckerd was absolutely amazing
